dfischer.utils

Class DNSCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.DNSCache

  • public class DNSCache
extends java.lang.Object
    A DNS resolver and cache that works independently from the OS.
    Note: Consideration of TTL is disabled by default, but can be enabled.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DNSCache()
      Create a new instance and set default DNS server(s).
      DNSCache(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dnsServers)
      Create a new instance and configure DNS server(s).
      DNSCache(DNSTranslationTable dnsTranslationTable)
      Create a new instance, set a DNS translation table, and set default DNS server(s).
      DNSCache(java.lang.String hostsFile)
      Deprecated. 
      since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted host file. Create a new instance, read the hosts file, and set default DNS server(s).
      DNSCache(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext, java.lang.String hostsFile)
      Create a new instance, read the hosts file, and set default DNS server(s).

        Create a new instance and set default DNS server(s).

      • DNSCache

        public DNSCache(SymmetricEncryptContext decryptContext,
        java.lang.String hostsFile)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new instance, read the hosts file, and set default DNS server(s).
        Parameters:
        decryptContext - the context to decrypt the file, or null if the file is not encrypted
        hostsFile - relative or absolute path to the hosts file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        Since:
        V5.4-K

      • DNSCache

        public DNSCache(java.lang.String hostsFile)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated. since V5.4-K, does not support encrypted host file. Create a new instance, read the hosts file, and set default DNS server(s).
        Parameters:
        hostsFile - relative or absolute path to the hosts file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • DNSCache

        public DNSCache(DNSTranslationTable dnsTranslationTable)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new instance, set a DNS translation table, and set default DNS server(s).

        Note 1: It could be needed that TLS SNI (Server Name Indication) must be disabled if a DNS translation table is used.
        Note 2: The HTTP request header field "Host" is not updated, so it might happen that you call the Web server with the wrong host name.

        Parameters:
        dnsTranslationTable - a DNS translation table
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        HttpSocketPool.setHintUseSNI(boolean)

      • DNSCache

        public DNSCache(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dnsServers)
        Create a new instance and configure DNS server(s).
        Parameters:
        dnsServers - the DNS servers used to query for host names (at least one DNS server must be specified).

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public DNSCache clone(boolean cloneTTL)
        Create a clone that contains a copy of the hosts, a copy of the DNS translation table and a copy of the DNS server configuration.
        Note: the clone contains only a copied reference to the hosts, to the DNS translation table and to the DNS statistic - meaning that the DNS statistic is not cloned (common aggregate of all instances). However, the clone contains a new, empty DNS cache.
        Parameters:
        cloneTTL - if true then clone also TTL configuration, false = TTL support is disabled for the clone

      • fromJSON

        public static DNSCache fromJSON(java.lang.String jsonData)
                         throws org.json.JSONException
        Create a DNS cache object from JSON data (w/o DNS translation table - set to null).
        Parameters:
        jsonData - the JSON data. Example: 
         {"DNSServers":["194.246.118.118","212.25.28.55"],"Hosts":[{"3.3.3.7":"aber.com"},{"127.0.0.1":"localhost"},{"1.8.8.9":"mama"}],"EnableTTL":true,"FixedTTL":-1}
        Note 1: all JSON elements such as DNSServers, Hosts, EnableTTL and FixedTTL are optional. If one or all of them are absent then default values are applied.
        Note 2: a FixedTTL value of -1 (minus one) means that no fixed TTL is configured (-1 = use TTL of DNS resolves). The unit for fixed TTL is seconds.
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException

      • setDnsServers

        public void setDnsServers(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dnsServers)
        Configure the DNS server(s).
        Parameters:
        dnsServers - the DNS servers used to query for host names (at least one DNS server must be specified).

      • getDnsServers

        public java.lang.String[] getDnsServers()

        the configured DNS server(s)

      • setHosts

        public void setHosts(DNSHosts dnsHosts)
        Set the data for the (virtual) DNS hosts file.
        Parameters:
        dnsHosts - the data for the (virtual) DNS hosts file, or pass null if no (virtual) DNS hosts file data should be used.

      • getHosts

        public DNSHosts getHosts()
        Get the data of the DNS hosts file.
        Returns:
        the data of the (virtual) DNS hosts file, or null if no (virtual) DNS hosts file is configured

      • setDNSTranslationTable

        public void setDNSTranslationTable(DNSTranslationTable dnsTranslationTable)
        Set the data for the DNS translation table.

        Note 1: It could be needed that TLS SNI (Server Name Indication) must be disabled if a DNS translation table is used.
        Note 2: The HTTP request header field "Host" is not updated, so it might happen that you call the Web server with the wrong host name.

        Parameters:
        dnsTranslationTable - the data for the DNS translation table, or pass null if no DNS translation table should be used
        See Also:
        HttpSocketPool.setHintUseSNI(boolean)

      • getDNSTranslationTable

        public DNSTranslationTable getDNSTranslationTable()
        Get the DNS translation table.
        Returns:
        the DNS translation table, or null if no DNS translation table is configured

      • getConfigInfoText

        public java.lang.String getConfigInfoText()
        Get a short information text about the configuration of the DNS cache.
        Returns:
        a short information text about the configuration of the DNS cache.

      • enableTTL

        public void enableTTL()
        Enable consideration of TTL by using the received values from the DNS Server(s).

      • isEnableTTL

        public boolean isEnableTTL()
        Check if consideration of TTL is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if consideration of TTL is enabled

      • setFixedTTL

        public void setFixedTTL(int ttl)
        Enable TTL by using a fixed value for all DNS resolves.
        Parameters:
        ttl - TTL in seconds

      • getFixedTTL

        public int getFixedTTL()
        Get the fixed TTL for all DNS resolves.
        Returns:
        the fixed TTL for all DNS resolves in seconds, or -1 if no fixed TTL is configured (= use DNS TTL)

        public static void setDebugToStdout(boolean enableDebug)
        Enable or disable to write debug information to stdout.
        Parameters:
        enableDebug - true = enable write debug information to stdout

      • isDebugToStdout

        public static boolean isDebugToStdout()
        Get if write debug information to stdout.
        Returns:
        true = write debug information to stdout

      • getIpAddress

        public java.lang.String getIpAddress(java.lang.String dnsHostName)
                              throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Get an IP address for a DNS host name. If multiple IP addresses are assigned to a host name the returned IP address will be randomly determined - only once when the first resolve is made.
        Parameters:
        dnsHostName - the DNS host name to resolve
        Returns:
        an IP address for the DNS host name
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • getIpAddress

        public java.lang.String getIpAddress(java.lang.String dnsHostName,
                            int userNumber)
                              throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Get an IP address for a DNS host name. If multiple IP addresses for the same host name are defined the address determined by the 'userNumber'.
        Parameters:
        dnsHostName - the DNS host name to resolve
        userNumber - an unique number per user
        Returns:
        an IP address for the DNS host name
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • resolveIpAddress

        public DNSCacheResolution resolveIpAddress(java.lang.String dnsHostName)
                                    throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Resolve an IP address for a DNS host name. If multiple IP addresses are assigned to a host name the returned IP address will be randomly determined - only once when the first resolve is made.
        Parameters:
        dnsHostName - the DNS host name to resolve
        Returns:
        data of resolved IP address.
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException

      • resolveIpAddress

        public DNSCacheResolution resolveIpAddress(java.lang.String dnsHostName,
                                  int userNumber)
                                    throws java.net.UnknownHostException
        Resolve an IP address for a DNS host name. If multiple IP addresses for the same host name are defined the address determined by the 'userNumber'.
        Parameters:
        dnsHostName - the DNS host name to resolve
        userNumber - an unique number per user
        Returns:
        data of resolved IP address
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException
